availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, tinner. Indiana native. Married to Sarah V. Cash Wheatley. Father of William W. Wheatley. Tinner in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Tinner in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed Thomas Price and J. A. Wills as Journeymen in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed P. Perryman as an apprentice in Caldwell County in 1860. Clerk in Caldwell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 71A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 112.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Caldwell County, KY, June 1863, p. 23.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994029, Caldwell County Births, p. 3.
"John Wheatley (1824-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial #197442236, accessed September 1, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197442236.
